name: Horizon Casino Resort- Lake Tahoe

reviews.title: Cheap but fun
reviews.text: What you pay is what you get. Reasonable rooms (not much of a view). Good offers on buffets / food / gambling - they want you to stay in the casino. Made our stay here very cheap!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beatles tribute act was good fun (albeit free!) Not much to do in South Lake Tahoe/Stateline, except ski. We went in March though! Most of the lake walks were closed due to snow.
reviews.title: OK, nothing more, nothing less.

reviews.text: Booked this hotel through Heavenly Vacations, so saying that to preface, I wasn't there for the hotel, I was there for the snow. Upon arrival, walked into the casino and was greeted by the smell of smoke from the casino, the lobby was nice and check in was very easy, however it seemed that the staff really was indifferent to our arrival. First put in the aspen tower, far far from the lobby, the room was two doubles, had asked for a king. After calling down to the lobby, this was quickly remedied, however we were now put into a joining room, with a family of kids next door. But as earlier stated, I wasn't there to rate the hotel.
reviews.title: Met my expectations - Not Harrahs or Harvey's but was clean

likes.disliked: — Temperature of the room - too warm at times.

reviews.text: The walls are VERY THIN. I could hear the elevator all night long from down the hallway, the kids next door, and the drunken group of gents across the hall. The beds were stiff, the sheets were clean, the bathroom was..... a bathroom. Honestly we didn't expect to much from the hotel, and we weren't disappointed. The location is the main perk, you can easily walk to the gondola @ Heavenly, or you can ride the shuttle, which comes around about every 20 minutes. The casino was unimpressive, but most casino's seem to be, at least to me.
reviews.title: Nervous start, but hotel came good

reviews.text: For the price paid, most of this was expected, however, won't be staying at the Horizon again, and wouldn't really recommend it for anyone looking for a nice room.
reviews.title: Horizon was OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Only if nothing else if available...

reviews.text: - Convenient location is about the only thing going for this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for the Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons:
reviews.title: Not a 3 star hotel!
Don't bother with this one...
reviews.text: - This is a really old hotel in desperate need of a remodel.
- Average buffet
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: (Overall grade: B-) We were able to check-in around 1:45 in the afternoon and were given what seemed to be one of the better rooms.
reviews.title: Decent hotel in Tahoe

reviews.text: It wasn't a great room, but it was decent and clean. The room was large with 1 king bed. The bathroom was average sized. The sheets were clean, but looked a bit old. One had a tear in it. They definitely needed to replace those sheets with new ones.
reviews.title: Horizon is ok

reviews.text: I would be fine with staying there again in the future.
reviews.title: Love the View...
You get what you pay for
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights at the Horizon Lake Tahoe. Beds are rather hard, pillows are too (and big), so along with the uncomfortable bed, I had to deal with the noise of the air conditioner.

reviews.title: Horrible Hotel Accomadations
reviews.text: Also, the next morning, took forever to get hot water for a shave and shower. The second morning, the knob broke and the shower/tub would not stop running hot water, so I had to call down for a repair man.
I am the last one to complain about hotels. I am very low maintenance.
reviews.title: Walls thin as paper! Rooms dated. OK price

likes.liked: — Location, Lake View, Price, Staff, movie theater
likes.disliked: — Noise! Pillows sucked! Needs updating desperately

reviews.text: I didn't pay much for this room so I don't have much room to complain.
reviews.title: Below average but good value

reviews.text: However, after staying here for one night I would have probably paid a
reviews.title: Fantastic Views

likes.disliked: — No coffee facilities in the rooms

reviews.text: little more to stay somewhere else. The rooms are really dated- I mean, they still have popcorn ceilings! They are clean but the hallways and the room have a stench. Doesn't bother me much-but I thought I would mention it to people that might have issues with that.
reviews.title: The location is great...this hotel is so so

likes.liked: — Location to Lake Tahoe and other casinos
likes.disliked: — Small Bathroom, TV channels that didn't work, Phone that didn't work and dead casino scene

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The worst part was the noise my neighbors were making. No, they were not partying, they were talking/arguing for hours. Not yelling, but I could hear almost every word they were saying. I went down to get a different room at 3:30 in the morning (bc I knew if I told them to be quiet they wouldn't stop-they sounded really ghetto and immature) and they gave me another room. The guy downstairs was cool about it but I still got the worst night of sleep in a long time.
reviews.title: Worst Place in Lake Tahoe

aka: Horizon Casino Resort- Lake Tahoe Hotel
description: The Horizon Casino Resort is located in the center of America's all-year playground, where you can enjoy golf, skiing or the beach, each just minutes away. With world class entertainment, free live music and dancing, and eight first run movie theaters, the Horizon offers the most exciting and complete entertainment experience at the Lake.
